original: tshig des ni don 'di ston par byed de //
analyzed: tshig des ni don 'di ston par byed de //
translated: That statement teaches this meaning:

original: rnal 'byor pa gang gis sems ting nge 'dzin la brtan par gyur pa ni bsod nams kyi las goms pa'i dbang gis brtan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang gis sems ting nge 'dzin la brtan par gyur pa ni bsod nams kyi las goms pa'i dbang gis brtan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The yogi who has stabilized the mind in samƒÅdhi has become stable by the power of cultivating meritorious karma.

original: rnal 'byor pa de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phrad par byed pa dang / chos ston par byed pa dang / rtags kyang ston par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phrad par byed pa dang / chos ston par byed pa dang / rtags kyang ston par byed do //
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas appear to that yogi, teach the dharma, and also display signs.

original: de dag gang gi gzugs kyis ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag gang gi gzugs kyis ston par byed ce na /
translated: In what forms do they appear?

original: rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs la sogs pas so //
translated: In the form of yoginƒ´s, and so on.

original: yang na phreng ba'i phyag ni bstan //
analyzed: yang na phreng ba'i phyag ni bstan //
translated: Or the hand gesture of a garland is displayed.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshogs des ni rnal 'byor pha dang rnal 'byor ma mngon sum du phrad par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshogs des ni rnal 'byor pha dang rnal 'byor ma mngon sum du phrad par bstan to //
translated: This verse set explains the direct encounter with the male and female yogis.

original: phreng ba yongs su btang byas nas //
analyzed: phreng ba yongs su btang byas nas //
translated: Having relinquished the garland,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig des na rtags bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig des na rtags bstan to //
translated: this line explains the signs.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni dam tshig med pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni dam tshig med pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExternal‚Äù means not the domain of those without commitments.

original: 'du ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma rnams 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'du ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma rnams 'dus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGathering‚Äù means the gathering of yoginƒ´s.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams 'dus pas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams 'dus pas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What do the yoginis do when they gather?

original: gang na rnal 'byor pa bsod nams kyi las dang ldan pa la me tog gi phreng ba gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang na rnal 'byor pa bsod nams kyi las dang ldan pa la me tog gi phreng ba gtong bar byed do //
translated: They bestow a garland of flowers on the yogi who has meritorious karma.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pa bkug nas nged kyi @201a * //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pa bkug nas nged kyi @201a * //
translated: Then, having summoned the yogi, they recite:

original: dam tshig la gnas par gyis shig ces zlos par byed do //
analyzed: dam tshig la gnas par gyis shig ces zlos par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúYou must abide by our commitments!‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor pa de yang 'di ltar zlo bar byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de yang 'di ltar zlo bar byed do //
translated: And the yogi recites:

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams ji ltar gsungs //
translated: ‚ÄúI will do whatever the yoginis say.‚Äù

original: de ltar thams cad bya dgos zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du rnal 'byor ma ci gsungs bdag gis bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bya dgos zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du rnal 'byor ma ci gsungs bdag gis bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI must do everything‚Äù means that at all times I must do whatever the yoginis say.

original: zhes zlo bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes zlo bar byed do //
translated: Thus he recites.

original: phyi rol gyi gnas la gang dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i ched du gdan la sogs pa bcu gnyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gnas la gang dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i ched du gdan la sogs pa bcu gnyis ston par byed do //
translated: For the sake of the yogi who delights in external places, the twelve seats and so on are taught.

original: tshig gang gis bcu gnyis ston par byed ce na //
analyzed: tshig gang gis bcu gnyis ston par byed ce na //
translated: By what words are the twelve taught?

original: gdan dang nye ba'i gdan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: gdan dang nye ba'i gdan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúSeat and nearby seat‚Äù and so on are taught.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas kyi gtso bo bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas kyi gtso bo bshad par bya'o //
translated: The principal abodes of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are to be explained.

original: sa bcu gnyis ni 'di rnams te //
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis ni 'di rnams te //
translated: The twelve stages are these:

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas par bya'o snyam pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / sa dang po rab tu dga' ba dang / sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa dang / sa gsum pa 'od byed pa dang / sa bzhi pa 'od snang ba dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas par bya'o snyam pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / sa dang po rab tu dga' ba dang / sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa dang / sa gsum pa 'od byed pa dang / sa bzhi pa 'od snang ba dang /
translated: The stage of action in faith, the first stage, the Joyous, the second, the Stainless, the third, the Radiant, the fourth, the Brilliant,

original: sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba dang / sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa dang / sa bdun pa ring du song ba dang / sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba dang / sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros dang / sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin dang /
analyzed: sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba dang / sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa dang / sa bdun pa ring du song ba dang / sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba dang / sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros dang / sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin dang /
translated: the fifth, the Hard-to-conquer, the sixth, the Realized, the seventh, the Far-reaching, the eighth, the Immovable, the ninth, the Excellent Intelligence, the tenth, the Cloud of the Teaching,

original: bcu gcig kun du bzang po'i sa dang bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu gcig kun du bzang po'i sa dang bcu gnyis so //
translated: the eleventh, the stage of the Good, and the twelfth.

original: ting nge 'dzin skye ba dang / gzungs goms par byed pa dang / chos shes pa dang / don shes pa dang / pra kri ta'i skad shes pa dang / gzhan gyis dris pa bsam mi dgos par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin skye ba dang / gzungs goms par byed pa dang / chos shes pa dang / don shes pa dang / pra kri ta'i skad shes pa dang / gzhan gyis dris pa bsam mi dgos par shes pa'o //
translated: the arising of meditative concentration, the cultivation of retention, the knowledge of the Dharma, the knowledge of the meaning, the knowledge of language, and the knowledge of eloquence.

original: de dag goms par byed pa la ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas par bya'o snyam pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag goms par byed pa la ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas par bya'o snyam pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of these is called the stage of action in faith, because it is thought that all beings should be converted to Buddhahood.

original: sngon du de kho na nyid mi shes pa la phyis de kho na nyid shes pas dga' ba'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du de kho na nyid mi shes pa la phyis de kho na nyid shes pas dga' ba'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The first stage is called the stage of joy, because one is joyful at first not knowing reality, and later knowing reality.

original: sa der ni gzhan yang bdag gi don byed pa bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa der ni gzhan yang bdag gi don byed pa bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: On this stage, one acts for the sake of others as if one were acting for one's own sake.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of generosity also increases.

original: sa der ni byang chub sems dpas de kho na nyid go nas sdig pa'i phyogs bag zhad tsam skyed pa bzod par mi nus nas der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa der ni byang chub sems dpas de kho na nyid go nas sdig pa'i phyogs bag zhad tsam skyed pa bzod par mi nus nas der gnas par bya'o //
translated: On this stage, the bodhisattva, having understood reality, is unable to tolerate even the slightest production of evil, and so he should abide in it.

original: bzod par nus nas gnyes pa dri ma med par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod par nus nas gnyes pa dri ma med par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having attained the ability to bear them, one should enter the stainless stage.

original: der zhugs nas sems can gyi skyon thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der zhugs nas sems can gyi skyon thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered that stage, one becomes free from all faults of sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'phel bar @201b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'phel bar @201b 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of morality also increases.

original: tshul khrims ma yin pa'i dri ma dang bral bas na sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma yin pa'i dri ma dang bral bas na sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one is free from the stain of immorality, the second stage is called the stainless.

original: sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ji tsam du 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma rnyed pa dang / thos nas don 'dzin par mi nus kyi bar du sa der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ji tsam du 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma rnyed pa dang / thos nas don 'dzin par mi nus kyi bar du sa der gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in that stage should remain there until he obtains the mundane meditative concentrations and is able to retain what he has heard.

original: sa der zhugs nas don byed pa dang / sdug bsngal la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sa der zhugs nas don byed pa dang / sdug bsngal la bzod pa'o //
translated: Having entered that stage, he acts for the benefit of sentient beings and is patient with suffering.

original: de'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of patience increases.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa 'od kyis snang bar byed pas nas gsum pa 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa 'od kyis snang bar byed pas nas gsum pa 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he illuminates with light immeasurable world systems by the power of meditative concentration, the third stage is called the luminous.

original: sa der gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnyed nas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang bcas par 'khor la ston mi nus pa'i bar dang / ser sna thams cad spong bar mi nus kyi bar du bshad ma thag pa'i sa der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa der gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnyed nas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang bcas par 'khor la ston mi nus pa'i bar dang / ser sna thams cad spong bar mi nus kyi bar du bshad ma thag pa'i sa der gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this stage, although he has attained the mundane meditative concentrations, is not able to teach the factors of enlightenment together with their retinue, and is not able to abandon all stinginess, he should remain on this stage that has just been explained.

original: nam zhig nus par gyur pa'i tshes bzhi pa 'od snang bar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: nam zhig nus par gyur pa'i tshes bzhi pa 'od snang bar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: When he is able, he should enter the fourth stage, the Radiant.

original: de na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rtag par sems kyi rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams spong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rtag par sems kyi rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams spong bar mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this stage, in order to abandon the conceptual thoughts of the mind, does not abandon the factors of enlightenment.

original: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: His perfection of effort becomes extensive.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa'i shing rnams bsreg pa'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'od snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa'i shing rnams bsreg pa'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'od snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this stage is said to have the power to burn up the trees of the afflictions and to illuminate the factors of enlightenment.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa dang / 'khor ba las sems phyir mi ldog gi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams thabs dang bcas par mi bsgom gyi bar du bshad ma thag pa'i sa der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa dang / 'khor ba las sems phyir mi ldog gi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams thabs dang bcas par mi bsgom gyi bar du bshad ma thag pa'i sa der gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this stage should remain on this stage until he has cultivated the four noble truths, until his mind does not turn back from cyclic existence, and until he has cultivated the factors of enlightenment together with the means.

original: de nus pa'i tshes lnga par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nus pa'i tshes lnga par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: He should enter the fifth stage when he is able to do this.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams thabs dang bcas par bsgom pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur kyang spang mi bya ba dang / bdud thams cad kyis rgyal bar mi nus pa'i phyir sa lnga pa rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams thabs dang bcas par bsgom pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur kyang spang mi bya ba dang / bdud thams cad kyis rgyal bar mi nus pa'i phyir sa lnga pa rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The fifth stage is called Difficult to Conquer because the bodhisattva who is in that stage, although he has become very much a sufferer, does not give up his cultivation of the factors of enlightenment together with their means, and because all the demons cannot conquer him.

original: der gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag par sgom pa la gnas pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpas bag chags ngan pa spangs nas bag chags bzang po'i @202a * //
analyzed: der gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag par sgom pa la gnas pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpas bag chags ngan pa spangs nas bag chags bzang po'i @202a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in that stage, by his constant practice of meditation, increases the perfection of meditation.

original: rgyu ma rnyed kyi bar du sa der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma rnyed kyi bar du sa der gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should remain in that stage until he has abandoned the bad propensities and acquired the good propensities.

original: rnyed par gyur pa'i tshes drug pa mngon du gyur par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed par gyur pa'i tshes drug pa mngon du gyur par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: When he has acquired them, he should enter the sixth stage, the Facing.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skyes par rtag par bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skyes par rtag par bsgom pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is fulfilled by the bodhisattva who is on that stage, because he cultivates the realization that all things are born from the combination of causes and conditions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyir sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyir sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sixth stage is called the Manifest because all the dharmas of all the TathƒÅgatas are manifest.

original: chos thams cad kyi rgyu ma shes kyi bar du sa der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rgyu ma shes kyi bar du sa der gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should remain on that stage until one knows the causes of all dharmas.

original: shes par gyur pa'i tshes bdun pa ring du song bar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par gyur pa'i tshes bdun pa ring du song bar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: When one knows them, one enters the seventh stage, the Far-reaching.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rgyu thams cad shes nas mi spong ba'i phyir thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rgyu thams cad shes nas mi spong ba'i phyir thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of means is fulfilled by the bodhisattva who is on that stage, because he knows all the causes and does not abandon them.

original: thabs kyi lam du zhugs pas ring du song ba'i phyir sa bdun pa ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi lam du zhugs pas ring du song ba'i phyir sa bdun pa ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The seventh stage is called the Far-reaching because one has entered the path of means and has gone far.

original: de na ji tsam gnas kyi bar du rgyu med par sems can gyi don byed pa ma rnyed kyi bar du der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de na ji tsam gnas kyi bar du rgyu med par sems can gyi don byed pa ma rnyed kyi bar du der gnas par bya'o //
translated: As long as he remains there, he should remain there until he finds the benefit of beings without cause.

original: rnyed par gyur pa'i tshes brgyad pa mi g-yo bar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed par gyur pa'i tshes brgyad pa mi g-yo bar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: When he finds it, he should enter the eighth stage, the immovable.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas nan tan ma byas par bsod nams kyi tshogs kun rnyed pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi don nyon mongs pa med par byed pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas nan tan ma byas par bsod nams kyi tshogs kun rnyed pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi don nyon mongs pa med par byed pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of vows increases for the bodhisattva who is in that stage, because he obtains the accumulation of merit without effort and because he benefits all beings without affliction.

original: rgyu med pa dang nan tan med pa dang / 'dar ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang nan tan med pa dang / 'dar ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no cause, no effort, and no fear.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the absence of these three, the eighth stage is called immovable.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pas pra kri ta'i skad du chos bstan pa la sogs pa so sor ston par mi nus kyi bar du bshad ma thag pa der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pas pra kri ta'i skad du chos bstan pa la sogs pa so sor ston par mi nus kyi bar du bshad ma thag pa der gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in that stage should remain there until he is able to manifest the Dharma taught by the TathƒÅgatas in the Prakrit languages and so on.

original: ston par nus par gyur pa'i tshes dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ston par nus par gyur pa'i tshes dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: and on the ninth stage, Excellent Wisdom, he is able to teach.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi stobs che ba'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi stobs che ba'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: On this stage, the power of wisdom increases greatly for the bodhisattva, and the perfection of power becomes predominant.

original: lam thams cad kyi sgo nas chos ston par nus pa dang / rkyen med pa dang / lhag pa rnyed pa'i phyir sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam thams cad kyi sgo nas chos ston par nus pa dang / rkyen med pa dang / lhag pa rnyed pa'i phyir sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: The ninth stage is called Excellent Wisdom because he is able to teach the Dharma from the point of view of all the paths, because he has no more obstacles, and because he has attained the remainder.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing khams mang por sprul par mi nus pa dang / 'khor mang po sprul par mi nus pa dang / sprul pa dpag tu med pa la sogs pa sprul par mi nus @202b pa dang /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing khams mang por sprul par mi nus pa dang / 'khor mang po sprul par mi nus pa dang / sprul pa dpag tu med pa la sogs pa sprul par mi nus @202b pa dang /
translated: On this stage, the bodhisattva should remain until he is able to emanate many buddha-fields, until he is able to emanate many assemblies, until he is able to emanate immeasurable emanations,

original: sems can gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs rnams smin par mi nus kyi bar du der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs rnams smin par mi nus kyi bar du der gnas par bya'o //
translated: and until he is able to ripen the mass of merit of sentient beings.

original: nus par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nus par gyur pa'i tshe /

original: de dag thams cad bshad ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor pa des 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bshad ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor pa des 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of that is accomplished by the yogi/nƒ´ just explained.

original: de'i phyir tshig 'di bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig 'di bstan par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this verse is taught:

original: rang bsdu rang gis byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bsdu rang gis byed pa'o //
translated: One should gather oneself by oneself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: And so on is taught.

original: chos 'byung gnas las byung ye shes //
analyzed: chos 'byung gnas las byung ye shes //
translated: The wisdom that arises from the source of phenomena

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje padma dang mnyam par sbyar ba las skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje padma dang mnyam par sbyar ba las skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: is the wisdom that arises from the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: thabs ldan zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ldan zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the method means endowed with the yoga of the deity.

original: des ni ye shes skye bar byed pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ye shes skye bar byed pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: That explains the cause of the arising of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang ye shes skye ba'i rgyu ni bskyod pa dang / ga pur spang bar mi bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes skye ba'i rgyu ni bskyod pa dang / ga pur spang bar mi bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i stobs so //
translated: Moreover, the cause of the arising of wisdom is the power of shaking, not abandoning camphor, and meditation.

original: de dag gi dbang gis ji lta bu'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis ji lta bu'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By the power of those, how does wisdom arise?

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: Free from all elaborations,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba /
translated: free from the two aspects of past and future,

original: rang gis rig pa /
analyzed: rang gis rig pa /
translated: self-awareness,

original: gzhan la tshig tu brjod par mi nus pa /
analyzed: gzhan la tshig tu brjod par mi nus pa /
translated: It cannot be expressed in words to others.

original: don thams cad mngon sum du byed par nus pa /
analyzed: don thams cad mngon sum du byed par nus pa /
translated: It is able to manifest all objects.

original: bems po ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: bems po ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: It is omniscient, not inanimate.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the wisdom of the past, future, and present.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It has the nature just explained.

original: padma'i myu gu rdo rjes mdzad pa'i kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi le'u brgyad pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: padma'i myu gu rdo rjes mdzad pa'i kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi le'u brgyad pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the eight chapters of the Hevajra Tantra composed by Vajra of the Lotus Sprout is complete.

original: // / dbang po drug ces bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / dbang po drug ces bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six sense faculties are the eye faculty and so forth.

original: phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the form aggregate and so forth.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni dbang po dang / yul lnga dang / sngon du gzugs @206a * //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni dbang po dang / yul lnga dang / sngon du gzugs @206a * //
translated: Among them, the form aggregate is the five faculties, five objects, and the form element.

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / mig gi dbang po'i rten la sogs pa dang / gzugs 'das pa la sogs pa la ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / mig gi dbang po'i rten la sogs pa dang / gzugs 'das pa la sogs pa la ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The two kinds are the four great elements and the eye faculty, etc., and the form of the past, etc.

original: tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms so ;
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms so ;
translated: The aggregate of feeling is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: / gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bco brgyad dang / tshor ba 'das pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa la tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bco brgyad dang / tshor ba 'das pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa la tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of feeling is also the eighteen kinds of feeling that arise from the contact of the eye, etc., and the immeasurable feelings of the past, etc.

original: 'du shes zhes bya ba ni rgyu rkyen 'dus pas mtshan mar 'dzin pa la 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes zhes bya ba ni rgyu rkyen 'dus pas mtshan mar 'dzin pa la 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of conceptualization is the apprehension of signs by the coming together of causes and conditions.

original: de'i rgyu ni gzugs la sogs pa dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni gzugs la sogs pa dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Its causes are immeasurable, such as form, etc.

original: de yang chung du dang / chen po dang tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang chung du dang / chen po dang tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is also small, large, and immeasurable.

original: de yang 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa la 'du shes kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa la 'du shes kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of perception is that which has the nature of past, present, and future.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sems las gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sems las gang byung ba'o //
translated: The aggregate of formations is that which arises from mind.

original: de la sems las byung ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems las byung ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among them, that which arises from mind is faith, etc., and passion, etc.

original: de yang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba'o //
translated: It arises in dependence on the eye faculty, etc.

original: de dag thams cad la 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: All of them are called the aggregate of formations.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug go //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the six consciousnesses, such as the eye consciousness, etc.

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du bstan pa dang ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du bstan pa dang ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is virtuous, nonvirtuous, indeterminate,

original: de ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: small, middling, and great.

original: de dag la ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: All of them are called the aggregate of consciousness.

original: nang gi gnas drug dang / phyi'i yul drug go //
analyzed: nang gi gnas drug dang / phyi'i yul drug go //
translated: The six internal sense bases and the six external sense objects.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni gzung 'dzin dang bral bzhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni gzung 'dzin dang bral bzhes bstan to //
translated: Its purity is taught as being free from subject and object.

original: rdo rje ma sgyur gzugs phung la //
analyzed: rdo rje ma sgyur gzugs phung la //
translated: The form aggregate is Vajrƒ´,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: and so forth.

original: lha'i rnam par dag pa bstan nas dbus kyi gtso bo zhal brgyad pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i rnam par dag pa bstan nas dbus kyi gtso bo zhal brgyad pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the purity of the deities, now the purity of the central principal deity with eight faces will be taught.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: phyag rnams kyi ni stong nyid dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: phyag rnams kyi ni stong nyid dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: the emptinesses of the hands

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang ; 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang ; 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: are the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the outer and inner, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great immensity, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / shin tu stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / shin tu stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of nature, emptiness of all phenomena,üîΩemptiness of intrinsic characteristics,üîΩemptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of essential nature,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa @206b nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / de la nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la ni nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa @206b nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / de la nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la ni nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Regarding that, what is called inner emptiness refers to the eye faculty and so forth.

original: mig gi yul gzugs la sogs pa la ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi yul gzugs la sogs pa la ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The objects of the eye, such as forms, are called outer emptiness.

original: de gnyis stong pa snyam pa'i sems de yang stong pas na phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis stong pa snyam pa'i sems de yang stong pas na phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since the mind that thinks those two are empty is also empty, it is called emptiness of outer and inner.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do snyam pa'i sems de yang stong nyid yin pas na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do snyam pa'i sems de yang stong nyid yin pas na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is so called because the mind that thinks ‚Äúall phenomena are empty‚Äù is also empty.

original: shar phyogs la sogs pa stong pa nyid la ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs la sogs pa stong pa nyid la ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the great is so called because the eastern direction, etc., are empty.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong pas don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong pas don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is so called because nirvana is also empty.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The emptiness of the compounded is so called because the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm are compounded.

original: de dag 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: They are called the emptiness of the compounded.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa med pa la ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa med pa la ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the uncompounded is so called because the absence of arising, absence of abiding, and absence of cessation is the emptiness of the uncompounded.

original: shin tu stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rtag par lta ba dang / chad par lta ba de gnyis kyi stong pa la ni shin tu stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rtag par lta ba dang / chad par lta ba de gnyis kyi stong pa la ni shin tu stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the extremely empty is the emptiness of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end is the emptiness of coming and going.

original: de la ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dor ba med pas na dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dor ba med pas na dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of non-rejection is the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang gis kyang ma byas pas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang gis kyang ma byas pas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of nature is the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena, which is not made by anything.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag de gnyis kyis stong pa la ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag de gnyis kyis stong pa la ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of compounded and uncompounded phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of defining characteristics is so called because all phenomena are empty of their own defining characteristics.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dus gsum gyi chos mi dmigs pa la ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dus gsum gyi chos mi dmigs pa la ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is so called because the phenomena of the three times are not apprehended.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu rkyen las skyes pa rnams ni don dam par med pas na ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu rkyen las skyes pa rnams ni don dam par med pas na ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature is so called because those which arise from causes and conditions do not exist ultimately.

original: de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni phyag bcu drug go //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni phyag bcu drug go //
translated: Their purities are the sixteen hands.üîΩThe purity of all feet is

original: zhabs kun bdud kyi dag pa yis //
analyzed: zhabs kun bdud kyi dag pa yis //
translated: the purity of the demons.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa ste /üîΩde ji @207a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa ste / de ji @207a * //
translated: This means that they destroy the demons of afflictions and so forth.

original: ltar 'joms par byed ce na /
analyzed: ltar 'joms par byed ce na /
translated: How do they destroy them?

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of wisdom.

original: shes rab de yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: shes rab de yang bzhi ste /
translated: That wisdom is also fourfold.

original: dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / gzhan rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / gzhan rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of things, the emptiness of non-things, the emptiness of own-nature, and the emptiness of other-nature.

original: de la dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po rang gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po rang gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, the emptiness of things is the emptiness of own-nature of things.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of non-things is the emptiness of non-things.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of own-nature is the emptiness of own-nature.

original: gzhan rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pas na gzhan rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pas na gzhan rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of other-nature is the emptiness of other-nature.

original: de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni zhabs bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni zhabs bzhir bstan to //
translated: Their purity is taught in the four feet.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi zhal //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi zhal //
translated: The eight liberations are the faces.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gzugs can gzugs la lta ba dang // sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rab tu byung ba'i spyod pa bslabs nas gnas pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas kyi skye mched la gnas pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa'i gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs la lta ba dang // sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rab tu byung ba'i spyod pa bslabs nas gnas pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas kyi skye mched la gnas pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa'i gnas pa dang /
translated: The first is the liberation of the form realm, where one sees form with the body.üîΩThe second is the liberation of the formless realm, where one abides in the base of infinite consciousness.üîΩThe third is the liberation of the formless realm, where one abides in the base of infinite space.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnas pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi gnas pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnas pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi gnas pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The liberation of the beautiful, the liberation of the formless, the liberation of the sphere of infinite space, the liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the liberation of the sphere of nothingness, the liberation of neither perception nor non-perception, and the liberation of cessation.

original: de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni zhal brgyad do //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni zhal brgyad do //
translated: The purification of those is the eight faces.

original: spyan dag rdo rje can gsum gyi //
analyzed: spyan dag rdo rje can gsum gyi //
translated: The three eyes of the vajra-holder

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par dag pa ni spyan gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par dag pa ni spyan gsum mo //
translated: are the purification of body, speech, and mind.

original: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten bcings //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten bcings //
translated: By whatever and whatever the world is bound,üîΩby that and by that the consciousness is bound.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa de dang de'i mun pas bcings pa'i shes pa ni shes pa de nyid kyi snang ba rang nyid grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa de dang de'i mun pas bcings pa'i shes pa ni shes pa de nyid kyi snang ba rang nyid grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness itself is liberated by the light of that consciousness.

original: padma'i myu gu rdo rjes mdzad pa'i kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi le'u dgu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: padma'i myu gu rdo rjes mdzad pa'i kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi le'u dgu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the ninth chapter of the Hevajra Tantra composed by Vajra-ratna is finished.

translated: The term moment refers to the sixteen moments of the path of seeing:üîΩthe perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, the Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin,üîΩthe perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, the subsequent Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin, the Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation,

analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang bcu drug go //
translated: the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation, the subsequent Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation, the Dharma knowledge of the truth of path,üîΩthe perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of path, the subsequent Dharma knowledge of the truth of path and the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: de lta bu'i rim pas mthong ba'i lam bsgoms pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa brgyad la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas mthong ba'i lam bsgoms pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa brgyad la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by cultivating the path of seeing, one abandons the eighty-eight afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu gnyis ni rtag par lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog @216b tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu gnyis ni rtag par lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog @216b tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang /
translated: The twelve afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are the view of permanence, the view of self, the view of annihilation, the view of the transitory collection, the view grasping rules and ritual as paramount,

original: the tshom dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: doubt, attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun ni gong ma'i de la rtag par lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba bor bas ltag ma kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun no //
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun ni gong ma'i de la rtag par lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba bor bas ltag ma kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun no //
translated: The seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are the same as the above, except that the view of permanence and the view of self are omitted.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang par bya ba yang de dang mthun no //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang par bya ba yang de dang mthun no //
translated: The same holds for the factors to be abandoned by the path of insight into cessation.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug gi ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang drug go //
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug gi ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang drug go //
translated: The factors to be abandoned by the path of insight into the path are six: attachment, hostility, conceit, ignorance, clinging to rite and ritual, and doubt.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / bsgom pas spang par bya ba bzhi spangs pas 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / bsgom pas spang par bya ba bzhi spangs pas 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One is not reborn in the realm of desire by abandoning the thirty-two factors to be abandoned by the path of insight into the realm of desire and the four factors to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: the tshom dang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: The five remaining proclivities are attachment, hostility, conceit, ignorance, and doubt.

original: de dag ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba sum cu rtsa gcig spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba sum cu rtsa gcig spang bar bya'o //
translated: One is not reborn in the realm of form by abandoning the thirty-one factors to be abandoned by the path of insight into the realm of form, with the exception of doubt.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same holds for the formless realm.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa brgyad la sogs pa spangs pas khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyu dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa brgyad la sogs pa spangs pas khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyu dang bral ba yin no //
translated: By abandoning the eighty-eight things to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and so on, they are free from the causes for taking rebirth in the three realms.

original: de dang bral ba ni khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Being free from those causes, they are said to be free from attachment to the three realms.

original: de la nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dang / rang rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dang / rang rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthe Buddhas of the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle‚Äù and ‚Äúthe Buddhas of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.‚Äù

original: de ni nyon mongs pa dang bral bas 'khor bar mi skye'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa dang bral bas 'khor bar mi skye'o //
translated: Because they are free from afflictions, they do not take rebirth in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to have attained nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de yang dper na me mar shi ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang dper na me mar shi ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the extinction of a butter lamp.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna and the PratyekabuddhayƒÅna?

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thos nas nyan thos kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thos nas nyan thos kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard the teachings from a perfect buddha, they become a perfect buddha.

original: de dag gi sgo nas chos bshad nas sems can 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi sgo nas chos bshad nas sems can 'dul bar byed do //
translated: They explain the Dharma through those [teachings] and train sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyis nyon cig par bskul nas nyan pas na nyan thos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyon cig par bskul nas nyan pas na nyan thos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ≈õrƒÅvaka because one listens after being urged by another to listen.

original: rang rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas ni sngon du rang gis thos pa bzung nas gzhan gyi man ngag la mi ltos par rang gi byang chub go bas na rang sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas ni sngon du rang gis thos pa bzung nas gzhan gyi man ngag la mi ltos par rang gi byang chub go bas na rang sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: The pratyekabuddha is called a self-buddha because, having previously memorized what was heard, one understands one's own enlightenment without relying on the instructions of another.

original: des tshig gi sgo nas bshad pa spangs nas sku'i sgo nas sems can dge ba bcu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: des tshig gi sgo nas bshad pa spangs nas sku'i sgo nas sems can dge ba bcu la 'god par byed do //
translated: Having abandoned verbal explanation, one establishes sentient beings in the ten virtues through the body.

original: de'i don ni gzhan gyi man ngag lam brten par rang gis go ba dang rang nyid sangs rgyas pas de'i ye shes yang dag zab ba ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni gzhan gyi man ngag lam brten par rang gis go ba dang rang nyid sangs rgyas pas de'i ye shes yang dag zab ba ste /
translated: The meaning of that is: understanding through relying on the instructions of another, and oneself becoming a buddha, that wisdom is perfectly profound.

original: de'i phyir rang rgyal gyi ming du bstan /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rgyal gyi ming du bstan /
translated: Therefore, the name pratyekabuddha is taught.

original: phung po lnga bdag med pa la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba la ni rtag par lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga bdag med pa la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba la ni rtag par lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The view of self and mine in the five aggregates, which are selfless, is called the view of permanence.

original: de lta bu phung po la sogs pa @217a * //
analyzed: de lta bu phung po la sogs pa @217a * //
translated: Such a view of the aggregates, etc.

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba dang / de yang rtag par lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba dang / de yang rtag par lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The view of a self in the absence of a self, and the view of permanence in regard to that self, is called the view of a self.

original: gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa la ni tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa la ni tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-violence toward others is called morality.

original: khyi nyal ba'i sa dang / ba lang mang po 'drul ba'i lam dang / ri dags gnas pa'i sa la sogs pa de dag tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khyi nyal ba'i sa dang / ba lang mang po 'drul ba'i lam dang / ri dags gnas pa'i sa la sogs pa de dag tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The places where dogs sleep, the roads where many cows congregate, the places where deer live, and so on, are called the places of sages.

original: gzhan yang thal ba'i steng na nyal ba dang / skra 'dreg pa dang / drang srong gi khrus byas pa'i sar khrus la 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba zab dang / ral pa 'dzin pa dang / shing shun gon pa la sogs pa la brtul zhugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thal ba'i steng na nyal ba dang / skra 'dreg pa dang / drang srong gi khrus byas pa'i sar khrus la 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba zab dang / ral pa 'dzin pa dang / shing shun gon pa la sogs pa la brtul zhugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, sleeping on ashes, shaving the head, going to bathe in the place where sages bathe, eating fruits and roots, wearing matted hair, wearing bark garments, and so on, are called austerities.

original: de ltar byed pa la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To practice in that way is called the overestimation of morality and austerities.

original: bden pa dang rin po che la yid gnyis su gyur pa la ni the tshom zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang rin po che la yid gnyis su gyur pa la ni the tshom zhes bya'o //
translated: Doubt is the indecision about truths and jewels.

original: khams gsum la chags pa la ni 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum la chags pa la ni 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
translated: Attachment is the desire to unite with an attractive object.

original: sems can nam sems can ma yin pa la zhe sdang skye ba la ni zhe sdang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can nam sems can ma yin pa la zhe sdang skye ba la ni zhe sdang zhes bya'o //
translated: Aversion is the desire to turn away from a repulsive object.

original: nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It has seven types:üîΩpride, excessive pride,üîΩpride of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚ÄùüîΩpride of thinking ‚ÄúI am better,‚ÄùüîΩpride of thinking ‚ÄúI am equal,‚ÄùüîΩpride of thinking ‚ÄúI am worse,‚Äù

original: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang ; nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad tsam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang ; nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad tsam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni rigs las che ba dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / nor dang / thos pa dang / de dag gzhan pas ches cha bas na che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni rigs las che ba dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / nor dang / thos pa dang / de dag gzhan pas ches cha bas na che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Excessive pride is thinking that one is superior to one‚Äôs superiors in terms of caste, beauty, wealth, learning, and so on.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni gong ma de dag 'dra ba yod bzhin du de bas kyang bdag che'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni gong ma de dag 'dra ba yod bzhin du de bas kyang bdag che'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Pride of pride is when one is proud of one's pride, thinking, I am superior to those who are superior to others.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs 'dra yang gzugs dang thos pa dang / nor dang / tshul khrims te de dag gis nga che'o snyam pa la ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs 'dra yang gzugs dang thos pa dang / nor dang / tshul khrims te de dag gis nga che'o snyam pa la ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Pride of thinking I is when one thinks, I am superior to others in terms of family, beauty, learning, wealth, or morality, even though one is equal to others.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni 'di la bdag tu lta ba yod kyi nga la bdag tu lta ba med do zhes zer ba dang / ngas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos shes la 'dis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mi shes so zhes zer ba la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni 'di la bdag tu lta ba yod kyi nga la bdag tu lta ba med do zhes zer ba dang / ngas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos shes la 'dis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mi shes so zhes zer ba la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Arrogance is when one says, I have the view of self, but this person does not have the view of self, or I know the supramundane Dharma, but this person does not know the supramundane Dharma.

original: rigs la sogs pa cung zad kyis chung ngo snyam pa la ni chung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa cung zad kyis chung ngo snyam pa la ni chung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Pride of inferiority is when one thinks one is slightly inferior in terms of family and so on.

original: yon tan med par nga la yon tan yod do zhes zer ba la ni log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan med par nga la yon tan yod do zhes zer ba la ni log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The claim that I have good qualities when one is without good qualities is called false pride.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa la sgrib par byed pas na ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa la sgrib par byed pas na ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance is called ignorance because it obscures knowledge.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa mi shes pa la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa mi shes pa la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, ignorance is the non-understanding of the truth of suffering, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag la ni sems can 'khor ba dang 'bral par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag la ni sems can 'khor ba dang 'bral par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those afflictions are called the bondage of sentient beings in cyclic existence.

original: yang na lus ngag yid gsum gyi bdag nyid nyon mongs par byed pas na nyon mongs pa @217b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na lus ngag yid gsum gyi bdag nyid nyon mongs par byed pas na nyon mongs pa @217b zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, they are called afflictions because they afflict the body, speech, and mind.

original: de nas rnal 'byor spyod pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor spyod pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Then, it says yoga practitioner.

original: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i byang chub ston par byed de /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i byang chub ston par byed de /
translated: Now, it teaches the enlightenment of the yoga practitioner.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams gang gis don dam par phyi rol gyi yin par 'dzin te /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams gang gis don dam par phyi rol gyi yin par 'dzin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says that those who ultimately apprehend forms and so on as external objects

original: des ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa'i dbang gis bstan pa la don dam par 'dzin to //
analyzed: des ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa'i dbang gis bstan pa la don dam par 'dzin to //
translated: The TathƒÅgata taught this by the power of his intention, but they take it as literally true.

original: de ni gcig dang du ma brtags pas don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gcig dang du ma brtags pas don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the ultimate, because it is examined as being one or many.

original: de don dam pa ma yin na yul dang dus la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de don dam pa ma yin na yul dang dus la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not the ultimate, what is the form of the ultimate that is determined by place, time, etc.?

original: de'i lan du dpag tu med pa'i dus nas phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags ma spang pa'i dbang gis shes pa la phyi rol yin par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lan du dpag tu med pa'i dus nas phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags ma spang pa'i dbang gis shes pa la phyi rol yin par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The answer is that it is the apprehension of external objects by consciousness, due to the power of the beginningless, false imagination of unreal, dualistic forms.

original: de'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of that is taught by the TathƒÅgata.

original: ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che las /
translated: In the noble Buddha-avatamsaka,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúO sons of the victors, these three realms are mind only.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sems tsam bsgoms pas byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems tsam bsgoms pas byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by cultivating mind only, one attains enlightenment.

original: shes pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo yin pas bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo yin pas bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Consciousness is said to be real because it is the nature of consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pas na brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pas na brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The external aspect is called false because it is not the nature of consciousness.

original: phyi'i bden pa ma yin par gtan tshigs de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi rang bzhin phung po lnga yang bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i bden pa ma yin par gtan tshigs de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi rang bzhin phung po lnga yang bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of that reason, the external is not true, and therefore the five aggregates, which are the nature of suffering and origination, are also not true.

original: des pa skyed pa'i nyon mongs pa yang bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des pa skyed pa'i nyon mongs pa yang bden pa ma yin no //
